title: [TEST] Add memoize to save test data
body:
Quite a few of our topi testcases relies on a reference numpy/scipy implementation which can be quite slow. This PR introduce a memoize function that tries to remember the input result pair generated by the function and pickle them to a ```.pkl_memoize_py2```  (or py3) folder, so next time function is called, the result is fetched from cache. This can enable cache across multiple run of testcase if CI workspace is preserved (which is our case)

The cache is done with keys in closure and function arguments, I have updated the testcases to use this syntax. In order to guarantee correctness, the restriction is that the memoized function can only capture or take int, str, float or tuple of them and these are used as cache key.

title: [TOPI] improve elemwise schedule
body:
Two problems with current elemwise schedule:
-  op.axis[0] doesn't get bind
-  split depends on op.axis[num_dim-1]. When it's 1, as in simplifyBatchNorm, the resulting schedule is that each block has only one thread.

@Laurawly  Could you please confirm this?

title: [APP] Android RPC
body: - [x] Build android JNI automatically - [x] OpenCL support & test - [x] Build & sign .apk - [x] Generate android .o & .so in python (seems that we can simply re-use `tvm.contrib.cc.create_shared`) - [x] reconnect when rpc session ends - [x] android rpc UT & Instrumentation test (integration test by `apps/android_rpc/tests/android_rpc_test.py`) Tested on my Redmi 4X Android Phone: Processor: AArch64 Processor rev 4 (aarch64) GLES: Qualcomm, Adreno (TM) 505, OpenGL ES 3.1 V@145.0 (GIT@Iebe23be877) ``` $ python3 android_rpc_test.py TVM: Initializing cython mode... [00:38:20] src/codegen/llvm/codegen_llvm.cc:75: set native vector to be 32 for target aarch64 [00:38:20] src/runtime/opencl/opencl_device_api.cc:194: Initialize OpenCL platform 'Apple' [00:38:20] src/runtime/opencl/opencl_device_api.cc:214: opencl(0)='Iris' cl_device_id=0x1024500 [00:38:21] src/codegen/llvm/codegen_llvm.cc:75: set native vector to be 32 for target aarch64 Run GPU test ... 0.000150427 secs/op Run CPU test ... 0.000331302 secs/op ```
